ogTitle: northern illinois university meteorology professor victor gensini on the destructive storm that slammed through the midwest on monday travelling from south dakota to ohio in 14 hours. - smarther news
ogDescription: this is our version of a hurricane.
quote: This is our version of a hurricane.
summary: Northern Illinois University meteorology professor Victor Gensini on the destructive storm that slammed through the Midwest on Monday travelling from South Dakota to Ohio in 14 hours.
body:
• The National Weather Service defines a derecho (pronounced “deh-REY-cho”) as a storm that causes major wind damage over 240 miles and includes wind gusts at around 60 mph.
  • Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Ohio, Nebraska, South Dakota, and Wisconsin were hit to varying degrees, with winds reaching up to 112 mph in central Iowa. Severe storms and turbulent winds overturned vehicles, destroyed crops, and tore down trees, structures, and power-lines.
  • As of Tuesday morning, more than a million across the Midwest were left without power. At least one fatality was reported and several others were injured.
